Description: Round stand or altar with base carved from limestone. Fine execution, top broken, inscribed "Apollos" on top (or bottom?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Described in EEF distribution list for the MFA as an "altar in form of column with traces of paint, on upper surface inscribed APOL [in Greek]". The piece is listed in the MFA Stone Ledger (no. S.1312) but is crossed out and no accession number is noted against it.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ME.4)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
